fields.description:
This has just started occurring. Log below:
https://gist.github.com/pitrou/7b945b6e58d42d7aafb9d669cd31eb5f

comments.body: The culprit is the added {{SETUPTOOLS_SCM_PRETEND_VERSION}} definition in {{ubuntu-cuda-python}}.

[~apitrou] but it also fails if you remove that with the same error. IIUC this envvar has to be set for the wheels to be built and is set within the crossbow jobs via the -e option. I added it to the environment so it is inherited from the calling env without having to be explicitly called. If you have not set the envvar it will remain unset (same as if it was not there).
It has never failed for me (and probably not for other people either), so that's weird.

> If you have not set the envvar it will remain unset (same as if it was not there).

Apparently not, it probably gets an empty value instead.

This is an archery issue, I checked within the container and it get's set to  'None'. archery SHOULD use docker-compose by default and that would use the yml to set the envvars but apparently it is also passing them in explicitly and redundantly  as {{-e var=value}}
Setting to "None" is definitely a bug indeed.
as a workaround you can use docker-compose run ubuntu-cuda-python directly for now

That said, it was also gratuitous to inherit {{SETUPTOOLS_SCM_PRETEND_VERSION}} specifically for this job, IMHO.
As I said, I've never needed to pass this environment variable locally, so I'm not sure in which situation it's required to pass it.

You can remove it from docker-compose.yml and test it, on my machine the same error occurred, that's why I added it as a convenience. If there is another way to avoid using it I am happy to add that, I used this as it is used in all crossbow wheel builds

Yes, but I wonder why it fails for you, because this has never failed for me (and I suspect for other people as well, otherwise someone else would have suggested to change it?). Does it fail only on the CUDA jobs?
[~apitrou] I found out why this fails for me without the envvar: I use git worktrees so my {{.git}} folder is not available to scm to find the version.
Interesting. Perhaps file a bug to https://pypi.org/project/setuptools-scm/ ?

It looks like they already support it [https://github.com/pypa/setuptools_scm/issues/258] but when running the docker job the dir containing the .git folder is not mounted only the arrow dir, so it's not a bug but rather due to my specific circumstances of using worktrees + docker. So I think this can be closed?
